title: As a MNC Admin, I want EBIS to automatically Create Cs for players on MY MNCs
custom_steps:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1744|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1744|smart-link] 

AC:

* When the new batch created in [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1744|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1744|smart-link] is run, EBIS is will also create new Câ€™s for any player who signed a Multi-Year Minor Contract AFTER the new mCBA was signed (4/1/23)
* These new Câ€™s will be created in Approved state (will not need to be tendered or submitted)
* The salaries used will be dictated by the terms of the MY Contract
* These players and Add Cs, will +*not*+ be displayed in the Add C widget

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Club permissions on RELEE updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* There will no longer be a submit workflow for RELEE transactions
* Instead of a Submit button, there will be an Approve button for all users with Admin permissions
** Clicking Approve will approve the transaction and remove the employee from the Org

title: As a BOC Admin, I no longer want an "Under Contract" status for employees
custom_steps:
AC:

* No transactions will set employees as â€œUnder Contractâ€�
* Employees currently â€œUnder Contractâ€� will not longer be displayed as such

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Club permissions on ASGEE updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* There will no longer be a submit workflow for ASGEE transactions
* In the Status & Dates section of the transactions scree, the Submitted and Submitted by field will be removed from the UI (will look similar to OFFSA
* Instead of a Submit button, there will be an Approve button for all users with Admin permissions
** Clicking Approve will approve the transaction
* Admin users will also see an Edit button on Approved transactions
* When Editing an Approved transaction, Club users will only be able to check the â€˜Exercisedâ€™ box on Option years
* BOC will retain the ability to edit any field on an approved transaction

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ASGEE tx updated to include Contract Information
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789774/Assign+Reassign+Employee|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789774/Assign+Reassign+Employee|smart-link] 

Wire: [https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_reassign_employee&g=1|https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_reassign_employee&g=1|smart-link] 

Context: While there will be no more UECâ€™s entered into ebis, we still need to know some high-level contract information for employees.

AC:

* There will be a Title field added to the Details subsection
** The field will be a text box and map to the existing Contract Title fields
* â€œNon-Baseball Operationsâ€� will be a value added to Employee Type, Level, and Position
* There will be a new Contract section added to the Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
* There will be a â€œContracted?â€� checkbox used to indicate whether the employee is a contracted employee or not
** If this box is checked, the following fields will become required:
*** Start Year
*** Non-Option Years
*** Option Years
* Once Non-Option Years and Option Years are populated, a table will be displayed, that displays the calculated years of the contract and will match the provided data discovery
** Option years will have a drop-down in the table so the option type can be entered

title: Overhaul of Minor League Insurance process
custom_steps:
The minor league insurance process is being overhauled.  The Highmark batch will be retired (eventually after opening day and not with this story) and a new Minor League Insurance batch will take its place.

The reason for the change is Highmark who currently receives the insurance updates from ebis and then passes them on to BCBS is no longer going to the middle man.  Instead ebis will send updates directly to BCBS in the form of a JSON file.  

<The method of sending is TBD as is the file format>

In order to allow the new process to work the highmark batch will need to be updated to NOT update the playerâ€™s MnInsFlag, MnInsDt, and MNInsOverrideFlag.  It should still do everything else, but those updates and the ebis link cache should be removed.

The new batch will use a view modeled after the existing highmark batch view and should perform the existing updates which were removed from the highmark batch.

In addition to sending over the nightly changes, BCBS has requested that file consist of EVERY player currently receiving MN Ins with each run, so a new section of the view will need to pull in everyone who currently has MN ins set to YES.  

The JSON file will consist of a single record per player and then any changes they have will be sent in a sublist.  Once we have the format for that new file, we can clarify details.

title: As a WLP Admin, I want a Date Filter added to the WLP Club Comm Screen in EBIS
custom_steps:
Context: Currently, the WLP - Club Comm widget returns all reports ever created.  Users would like to export a smaller amount of reports.

AC:

* There will be a date range filter added to the header of the Reports widget on the WLP - Club Comm dashboard
* The beginning of the date range will default to Current Date - 6 Months
* The end of the date range will default to Current Date

title: INC0220594: As a MNC Admin, I want Clubs allowed to outright players without an active MNC after the season ends
custom_steps:
Rule 6.23: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788774/6.+Major+Minor+Outright|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788774/6.+Major+Minor+Outright|smart-link] 

Context: Currently, Clubs are blocked from Outrighting players if they do not have an active MNC.  This hard error should be turned to a soft warning after the conclusion of the MN Season.

AC:

* If a Club submits an Outright tx for a player after the â€œTo Clubâ€™sâ€� MN Season has ended, the resulting message will be a soft error.
** â€œThis transaction may only be performed on a player with an active Minor League Contract.â€�
* After the Rule 5 Date, the message will return to be a hard error
** Existing logic: after the Rule 5 Date, the rule check begins looking at the following year for a MNC

title: As a user I want minor contracts created for the following year for outrighted players to check the following year for an MJC rather than current year
custom_steps:
Outrighted playerâ€™s signing contracts for the following year (2024) are currently having their 2023 MJC salary linked to the new MNC.  Instead, we should be checking for a 2024 MJC salary.  If there is none, the contract will not display the MJC salary value and will instead allow the user to enter whatever they would like for each level.

Changing the start year toggle between next year and current year will need to re-calculate this information.

title: As a MN Payroll User, I want to open a player's profile from the MN Payroll Utility
custom_steps:
AC:

* Clicking a playerâ€™s name in the Player Summary will open the playerâ€™s profile
* There will be a new column, to the right of the Player column
* This column will have a â€œView Breakdownâ€� link for each player
* Clicking this link will load the player into the Breakdown section of the screen
** Playerâ€™s name will be displayed in the player drop down in the Breakdown section

title: As a BOC Admin, I want MJ Players to be put on Outright after a R5 Return
custom_steps:
Rules: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788781/3.+Return+of+Rule+5+Selection|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788781/3.+Return+of+Rule+5+Selection|smart-link] 

AC:

* When a player selected in the MJ Phase of the R5 Draft is returned, the Return of R5 Player transaction will serve as an outright tx
* On submission, the playerâ€™s pending MJ Roster Status will be updated to Outrighted
* On approval, the playerâ€™s MJ Roster Status will be updated to Outrighted



Note: this story should also cover data fixing any players that we're returned in 2023 and are not being handled correctly

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to keep a player on the IL after approving a WCA
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player on the IL is claimed off the waivers, the resulting Waiver Claim Assignment will have a â€œRemain on Injured Listâ€� checkbox
** If the player is not on the IL, the checkbox will not appear
* If this box is checked when the WCA is approved, the player will remain on the same Injured List when he is transferred to his new Org
* If the box is not checked when the WCA is approved, the player will become Active (current functionality) when he is transferred to his new Org

title: Migrate the System Dates screen to React
custom_steps: Recreate the System Dates screen in React

title: Ebis error. warning, and success handling
custom_steps:
When ebis returns an error or a warning the appropriate message should be displayed in a modal.

If only warnings are returned, then clicking override will resubmit the request with the overrideFlag set to true and the request should complete successfully.

When requests complete successfully, any success messages generated by the server should be displayed as alerts at the top of the screen.

title: EBIS React - Convert Batch page to react
custom_steps: Convert the batch listing page and batch utility page to React

custom_steps:
AC:

* This will work similar to existing functionality for Spanish language
